section.title: Overview
&kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
none.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications

para.emphasis: The following packages are runtime libraries, required to launch

listitem.para: java-common Base of all Java packages.
default-jre Standard Java or Java compatible Runtime.
gcj-jre Java runtime environment using GIJ/classpath.
libgcj12 (>=12) Java runtime library for use with gcj.

para.emphasis: The following packages are optional, required for development

listitem.para: ant Java based build tool like make.
ant-contrib Collection of tasks, types and other tools for Apache Ant.
ant-gcj Java based build tool like make (GCJ).
default-jdk Standard Java or Java compatible Development Kit
gcj-jdk gcj and classpath development tools for Java(TM)
libgcj13-dev (>=12) Java development headers for use with gcj
jdk JDK Development Kit (either oracle jdk or openjdk)

section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be compiled before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
The following packages are runtime libraries, required to launch
<class_name>.class
&kamailiobinary;.jar

section.title: JRE or JDK is required to use this module
section.para: Java runtime library (JRE and JDK for building app_java) is required to use this module.

section.title: class_name (string)
section.para: The class name should have the same compiled file name. If the value is "&kamailio;", then the compiled file should be named as "&kamailio;.class".

example.title: Set class_name parameter
example.programlisting: ... modparam("app_java", "class_name", "&kamailio;") ...

example.title: Set child_init_method parameter
example.programlisting: ... modparam("app_java", "child_init_method", "my_mod_init") ...

section.title: java_options (string)
section.para: Java options for Java Virtual Machine. For more info read java docs

example.title: Set java_options parameter
example.programlisting: ... modparam("app_java", "java_options", "-Djava.compiler=NONE") ...

example.title: Set java_options parameter (live configuration)
example.programlisting: ... # Assumes "application java folder" is located at /opt/kamailio/java modparam("app_java", "java_options", "-Djava.compiler=NONE -Djava.class.path=/path/to/kamailio/modules:/opt/kamailio/java: /opt/kamailio/java/kamailio.jar") ...

example.title: Set java_options parameter (verbose configuration)
example.programlisting: ... # Assumes "application java folder" is located at /opt/kamailio/java modparam("app_java", "java_options", "-verbose:gc,class,jni -Djava.compiler=NONE -Djava.class.path=/path/to/kamailio/modules: /opt/kamailio/java:/opt/kamailio/java/kamailio.jar") ...

example.title: Set java_options parameter (debug configuration)
example.programlisting: ... # Assumes "application java folder" is located at /opt/kamailio/java modparam("app_java", "java_options", "-Xdebug -verbose:gc,class,jni -Djava.compiler=NONE -Djava.class.path=/path/to/kamailio/modules: /opt/kamailio/java:/opt/kamailio/java/kamailio.jar") ...

section.title: force_cmd_exec (int)
section.para: This parameter forces execution a &kamailiobinary; comnmand with java native method KamExec. # Note: this is an untested yet feature, may cause (but may not) a memory leaks if used from embedded languages.

example.title: Set force_cmd_exec parameter
example.programlisting: ... modparam("app_java", "force_cmd_exec", 1) ...

section.title: Common requirements
section.para:
Each function has a required parameter method_signature. For more info see Determine the signature of a method. Signature represents the variable type. The mapping between the Java type and C type is
Type Chararacter boolean Z byte B char C double D float F int I long J object L short S void V Note that to specify an object, the "L" is followed by the object's class name and ends with a semi-colon, ';' .

section.title: java_method_exec(method, method_signature, [param1[, param2[, ...]]])
section.para: Executes a java class method method. Parameter method_signature is required.

example.title: Signature: "V"
example.programlisting: java_method_exec("ExampleMethod", "V");
public int ExampleMethod();

example.title: Signature: "Ljava/lang/String;I"
example.programlisting: java_method_exec("ExampleMethod", "Ljava/lang/String;I", "Hello world", "5");
public int ExampleMethod(String param1, int param2);
example.para: In the above scenario parameter 2 ("5") will be cast to integer representation.

example.title: Signature: "ZB"
example.programlisting: java_method_exec("ExampleMethod", "ZB", "true", "0x05");
public int ExampleMethod(boolean param1, byte param2);
example.para: In the above scenario parameter 1 ("true") will be cast to boolean representation.

example.para: In the above scenario parameter 1 ("true") will be cast to boolean representation.
